title: anyone else have this problem?

embed.description: Gyazo lets you instantly grab the screen and upload the image/GIF to the web. You can easily share them on Chat, Twitter, Blog, Tumblr, etc. Available for Windows, Mac and Linux.

body:
my cousin and I are playing and he said his screen is all messed up, well he sent me this picture.

It may be being caused by him recently installing windows 10 and this is the first time playing league since then, just wondering if anyone else has had this problem and if so how can you fix it?

replies.body:
Hey Lime,

That's a pretty trippy picture, the reds and blues remind me of those 3D glasses back in the day; it looks like your cousin might have 3D options turned on. I've seen this in the past when I had 3D Vision enabled on my computer; is he running a GeForce video card? If so, can you have him try the following:

* Go to the system tray (bottom right corner of the screen).
* Right-click on the GeForce icon (it can be associated with GeForce Experience or GeForce Control Panel).
* Click on GeForce Control Panel.
* Look for "Stereoscopic 3D" and click on "Set up stereoscopic 3D."
* Make sure to **un-check** "Enable stereoscopic 3D."

Ask him to try a Custom Game with you afterwards and see if anything has improved. If the problem still exists, have him contact us through the [Support Site](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/requests/new) and my colleague will be happy to help him.

> [{quoted}](name=Son Golin,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=3XJbUY5L,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2015-10-13T23:31:46.623+0000)
>
> Hey Lime,
> 
> That's a pretty trippy picture, the reds and blues remind me of those 3D glasses back in the day; it looks like your cousin might have 3D options turned on. I've seen this in the past when I had 3D Vision enabled on my computer; is he running a GeForce video card? If so, can you have him try the following:
> 
> * Go to the system tray (bottom right corner of the screen).
> * Right-click on the GeForce icon (it can be associated with GeForce Experience or GeForce Control Panel).
> * Click on GeForce Control Panel.
> * Look for "Stereoscopic 3D" and click on "Set up stereoscopic 3D."
> * Make sure to **un-check** "Enable stereoscopic 3D."
> 
> Ask him to try a Custom Game with you afterwards and see if anything has improved. If the problem still exists, have him contact us through the [Support Site](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/requests/new) and my colleague will be happy to help him.

Interesting. Don't know why I didn't think of that. 
Why isn't stuff like this in the wrenthmen's toolbox? :3

It's a pretty rare thing to happen but generally it gets turned on when nVidia updates drivers after upgrading Windows to a new version. Unfortunately, not everything can be anticipated but maybe we can add that in now. I am sure as people continue upgrading to Windows 10 a few people will get this featured turned on by accident.

> [{quoted}](name=Son Golin,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=3XJbUY5L,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2015-10-13T23:31:46.623+0000)
>

> 
> That's a pretty trippy picture, the reds and blues remind me of those 3D glasses back in the day; it looks like your cousin might have 3D options turned on. I've seen this in the past when I had 3D Vision enabled on my computer; is he running a GeForce video card? If so, can you have him try the following:

update:
he reinstalled it, and nothing changed, same problem. I told him 2 reset back to windows 8 and its working fine, he was messing around in windows 8 and found the 3d setting you were talking about, but we couldnt find it on windows 10
could be an auto set up on windows 10 or something

This actually can be automatically set up when upgrading Windows 10 from Windows 8.1, good observation. It happened to a lot of people upgrading from Windows 8, to Windows 8.1 as well when using an nVidia graphics card (stock or after market). The driver updates during the install process and the card by default gets enabled to force stereoscopic 3D when playing games. I had the same thing happen to me a few years ago. It was pretty weird to deal with.

> [{quoted}](name=Son Golin,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=3XJbUY5L,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2015-10-13T23:31:46.623+0000)

I've seen this in the past when I had 3D Vision enabled on my computer; is he running a GeForce video card? If so, can you have him try the following:
> 
> * Go to the system tray (bottom right corner of the screen).
> * Right-click on the GeForce icon (it can be associated with GeForce Experience or GeForce Control Panel).
> * Click on GeForce Control Panel.
> * Look for "Stereoscopic 3D" and click on "Set up stereoscopic 3D."
> * Make sure to **un-check** "Enable stereoscopic 3D."
> 
> Ask him to try a Custom Game with you afterwards and see if anything has improved. If the problem still exists, have him contact us through the [Support Site](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/requests/new) and my colleague will be happy to help him.

He dosnt have any after market graphics card, its just the stock set up.
He hasnt changed anything else on there besides upgrading to windows 10 and it only apears when its in the league game, not on anything else.

He ran the repair thing, that didn't work but now hes uninstalled it and re installing it now

but thanks for idea

Well if you could get a Dxdiag from their computer I could check what drivers are on the computer.
https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs

It should be under DirectX diagnostic in that link on how to get and post it( youll have to paste the information into something like http://pastebin.com/ )

When you install windows 10,

1. Run windows update, this will get things like .net runtime
2. If windows update doesn't have graphics updates for drivers, you may need to find and install them manually.

> [{quoted}](name=tseihei,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=3XJbUY5L,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-10-13T22:58:32.603+0000)
>
> When you install windows 10,
> 
> 1. Run windows update, this will get things like .net runtime
> 2. If windows update doesn't have graphics updates for drivers, you may need to find and install them manually.

thanks man ima try to find out how to check for that
